description.summary: request shadow rendering for layer surfaces

protocol.description:
This protocol provides a way for clients to request that the compositor render a shadow behind their layer shell surfaces.
This is useful for floating panels, notifications, and other overlay elements that want a drop shadow effect without having to render it themselves.

interface.name: layer_shadow_manager_v1
interface.description: Manager for creating shadow objects for surfaces. This is designed for layer shell surfaces but works with any wl_surface.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will no longer use this global. Any previously created shadow objects remain valid until destroyed.

request.name: get_shadow

description.summary: Create a new shadow object for a surface

request.description:
Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_surface to request shadow.
If the given wl_surface already has a layer_shadow_surface_v1 object associated, the shadow_exists protocol error will be raised.

entry.name: shadow_exists
entry.summary: the surface already has a shadow object

interface.name: layer_shadow_surface_v1
interface.description:
The shadow object provides a way to request a shadow for its associated surface.
If the wl_surface associated with the layer_shadow_surface_v1 object has been destroyed, this object becomes inert. Any further requests other than destroy will raise the surface_destroyed protocol error.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will no longer be using this protocol object. The shadow will be removed on the next commit.

request.name: enable
request.description:
This request enables shadow rendering for the surface.
The shadow state is double-buffered and will be applied on the next wl_surface.commit.

request.name: disable
request.description:
This request disables shadow rendering for the surface.
The shadow state is double-buffered and will be applied on the next wl_surface.commit.
